oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Tennessee state gazetteer and business directory. Nashville, Tenn.: R.L. Polk & Co., 1877.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gruetli. A Swiss settlement centrally located in Grundy county, 12 miles from Altamont, the county seat, and about 100 from Nashville. It was settled in 1869 and incorpo rated in 1870. Present population nearly 100. Baine’s creek supplies power for a corn and saw mill, and there are several artisans, a general store, Reform church, and German and English public school in the place. Tracy City, on the N. C. & St. L. Ry., is the shipping point. Mail is received daily. Christ. Marugg, postmaster. Business Directory. Bianchy, M., mason. Boesch, W., painter. Buettiker, Ferd., carpenter. Goelz, Abraham, saddler. Heer, H., butcher. Marugg, Martin, miller. Marugg, Rudolf, Saw Mill. Moritz, Car], General Store and Saloon. Von Rohr, L. B., blacksmith and wagon maker. Werner, Samuel, carpenter. Wichser, David, butcher.
